intro: Banksia lemanniana, commonly known as the Leeman's banksia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to the south-western region of Western Australia, where it typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and its distinctive, cylindrical flower spikes that range in color from yellow to orange. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of white wax. The species is well adapted to the dry, Mediterranean climate of its native habitat.
